section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The phrase "at their discretion and convenience" directly contradicts the statement about timely payments and potential service interruption. If the customer can pay at their discretion, there is no defined 'timely manner'. This creates confusion as to when payment is actually due and enforceable, undermining the clause regarding service interruption for non-payment.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The statement regarding 'discretion and convenience' introduces ambiguity, weakening i-on's ability to enforce timely payments. A legally sound contract needs clear payment terms. The added phrase creates a loophole that could be exploited, making it difficult to enforce payment obligations under Florida law.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The contract states it will automatically renew for one month periods, unless notice is given. It then states that either party may terminate the agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen days' written notice. This presents a contradiction because if either party can terminate at any time with 15 days written notice, there is no real renewal term, because the agreement can be terminated at any point during this renewal term.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The two statements present conflicting views on termination. The clause regarding automatic renewal creates an expectation of a continued one-month commitment unless cancelled, while the 'terminate at any time' clause undermines this expectation. This creates ambiguity regarding the actual commitment period and the conditions under which termination can occur, potentially leading to disputes.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: The phrase "i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages" directly contradicts the following sentence, which states: "i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees." The first sentence does not set any limitations, while the second sentence does, which directly contradicts the sentence before.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: The first part of the text mentions that i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. This legal statement is vague, leading to multiple interpretations. A legal contradiction under this category happens when an obligation is introduced ambiguously, making it difficult to enforce under state or national law.
